intro: Tretorhiza straminea, commonly known as the slender tretorhiza, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or wet meadows. Its reproductive structures include both stamens and pistils, facilitating wind pollination. Tretorhiza straminea is often found in temperate regions and plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
